xPZ5rBZFTMlv8VRI9FX7rw.text: Why it took me so long to become a fan is beyond me.  Yes, I heard about Primanti's from friends and co-workers for years and never tried them.  It's when they went franchise, and bicoastal is when I tried them.   I must say that they are so very tasty!! Everything I've tried have been a sports bar meal favorite!!  Each time I've had the BEST service, and have been more than satisfied with the food.  Usually I'll get one of their delicious Grilled Chicken Salads, topped with everything you can think of.  I love their signature sandwiches, and you have to get it WITH the cole-slaw. YUM, yummies!!  Not everybody likes the coleslaw, so I was very surprised to say that it is GREAT!  Fit's perfectly for this PITTSBURGH created staple!  Anyway, go on in!! It's especially fun for Steeler, Penguin or even Pirate games!

OnxXMrOMiQddaFAcexVD1Q.text: I was super excited to finally try this place and was INCREDIBLY disappointed. The slaw was mediocre and the meat was dry and tasteless. The slice of pizza was pretty good but everything else was a big waste of time. Won't be coming back to this place if I'm ever in Pittsburgh again

DMFS2HFjKLf9LmU4fOENGg.text: I waited over an hour for my two slices of pizza to come out, and they were room temperature when they arrived. I watched at least 15 other people seated after me order, receive their food, eat and the pay their tab and leave. I was told the manager was on their way out and they never showed up. I'm definitely never coming to this Primantis again, and possibly never going to another at all.

_hQ-7DTJFuKD40V1UQI2yg.text: PROS: consistent food quality inexpensive Great bar area for "watchin' the game" with HUGE TV's all over! Pool Table  CONS: servers are "so-so"  Not much more to say on this one. I remain unimpressed but there are some personal food cravings that I experience from time to time.  My FAVES:  Pizza Pulled Pork Sandwich Ranch Fries (Soooo simple, but soooo tasty)  This place is good for kids earier in the evening.  Pretty friendly atmosphere for dinner.

yPSmcMRDus2DzYxUnRIZ4g.text: Overrated, and I like using dishes and silverware when I eat, so I wasn't too impressed by the place.

ZHeWq5K3CEsyodrpwcz4xA.text: I think their sandwiches are just okay. They don't have enough meat on them but a ton of fries and Cole slaw. A little more meat and they would be a lot better. As for their #2 best seller. Dry and tasteless.

INwMlBidhk8TfYXvt8yYxw.text: I've tried a bunch of different locations and they each have their own vibe. I prefer the sports bar vibe in N Versailles over the family restaurant vibe that some of the other locations possess. Primantis' is great for watching the game, drinking cold beer and eating their famous sandwiches. If you order an entree then you're missing the whole reason why Primanti Bros is famous! Order the piled high Roast Beef with tomato, fries and slaw and enjoy one of the best sandwiches you'll ever have!

wSWI7WWLqBT-zqYd3d3HOQ.text: Since moving from Pittsburgh 5 years ago, my cravings for the wonderful "Primanti sammich" has increased. I make it back about once a year and a trip to this fine establishment is the law. Of course, the ones downtown are a little more "YINZER" but the suburban locations are a bit quieter, quaint and a lot less waxed paper is used. The food is still amazing though! My favorite sandwich is the cheese combination because when I started eating Primanti's they didn't have the turkey and I don't eat red meat or bacon.  I know a sandwich with french fries and cole slaws sounds weird...and I have to admit the first time I ate one I wasn't sold right away...but you'll get hooked, I promise! A must for anyone visiting the Burgh!

XsqFBJsCqihKNOP8Cx2LXQ.text: Normally, I would give them 4 stars, but the last time I went there, they changed their pizzas by putting in more garlic. It just doesn't taste right.

DFcMza5vl3TPJafey76OzA.text: You can't visit the Pittsburgh area without trying a Primanti Bros. sandwich. Luckily there is one located in North Versailles, my wife's hometown. If we need a quick lunch or we are meeting up people Primanti's is usually the go to location.   As you know, the best part about their sandwich is that they put the slaw and fries in the sandwich. These sandwiches are HUGE and I have a hard time finishing one. I usually get the Black Angus Top Sirloin or the The Pitts-burger.  This location has a great wait staff. They never let your drink get empty. The food comes out fast and hot. I have not been to other locations but the one in North Versailles is top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States

cUvTpE56ut0cZQ2r2abeeA.text: Easy parking, a fun ambiance and a really nice waitress. The hamburger was a tiny meatloaf tasting beef patty, so so coleslaw and fries piled between two thick slices of un-roasted white bread.  I thought it was just okay but beloved by many.  I meant to initially give three stars, so review has been updated.

5qb8hLL5_IBQNwoR8AxXhg.text: This is Primanti for when you can't make it to downtown Pittsburgh. I actually prefer the Monroeville location for ambiance and service, but the North Versailles location is not bad either.  Basically, I ignore everything on the menu except for the Primanti sandwiches. These are sandwiches where the fries and coleslaw are stuffed into the sandwich. If the fries are seasoned adequately and the coleslaw is not too sour, there's nothing quite like it. It's the sandwich I look forward to on my annual Pittsburgh trips, although perhaps not so much any more since I can now visit the new Primanti location in York.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. Bacon, egg and cheese sandwich

sNrDK4_VG970L3_Hjf9kxg.text: over priced  food and water down drinks  oj manager hes useless to talk to

Lecb0bFGBbJfhB1uCs5ETA.text: Wins are always subpar , online orders always take 2-3 times estimated time. Wouldn't even go here if it wasn't a quarter mile from my house.

k2HYH9e0AmYnJxKDlJWoaw.text: This is probably my least favorite primanti bros in Pittsburgh. The food service is horrible. It took the server more than 30 mins to greet us. On top of all the time it took to greet us.. the food also took forever. It seemed so short staffed inside and the staff is very unpleasant to the customers. I hope primantis is able to fix this location because it makes me never want to come back.

yIUtxPpfUaM-dptlljzlhQ.text: Good food, friendly staff...works for me everytime! Nothing says Picksburgh like a Primanti's n'at!

6Lf-WMIyhHzW4m3__XawPg.text: Was not happy today .  Did anyone ever eat there hamburger s.  ? They are horrible.  Also I got a 4 cut pizza it was not up to par.  Place is overrated.  A True Pittsburgher here...love the concept..but , come on guys step your game up.

Z6kjUKaHqMMnUGqT_Rjj5w.text: I always enjoy Primanti's, but I suppose one must accept slow service from time to time to get great food.  Despite a lull in patronage (between lunch and dinner), it took unbearably long for the food to arrive - allegedly because of "prepping the pulled pork".   Then there was the long wait for the high chair, the check, processing the payment, and finally the container for the leftovers.  You may interpret my rating as an average of a solid "5" for the food and a generous "3" for the lackluster service.

FKSNb8i-9UemsPPp0DfqXw.text: Went here this past Saturday night at 7pm with the intent of having a few drinks with friends, getting some dinner, and watching the penguins game.     We sat at the booth for 30 minutes after our drink order was taken and never got our drinks.  We could see them sitting on the end of the bar getting watered down.   Never did see our waitress again after she took the drink order and the one other waitress that came around ignored us.     Also, for a Pittsburgh sports bar, only 1 tv had the pens game on.   A small tv facing the corner of the dining room.   We ended up walking out and spent our money at another establishment.

BrLAE8g8PfI2ZEgL9WXvqw.text: No pretense at all and when I think of where to go when in PGH for a relaxed meal and a drink or "two", this is always good.  I've had the wings the last couple times I've been and they are quite good-very crispy and meaty and dripping in sauce-hot Buffalo (medium plus, I'd say) and parmesan garlic were both good.  Eating one of their signature sandwiches is enhanced the later in the evening it is, or if you're fighting back the morning after a rough one.  Still, pretty good, but the beef patty ("#2 best seller") won't be my choice next time (BLT, fish or pastrami are better).  This particular location is comparable to the original or the one in Monroeville, so I wouldn't miss one to go to the other.

KPI6Z4oBV8Mj_thp6SDU7g.text: I've never had one of their sandwiches before. I was talked into having on for lunch today. I'll never do it again. I bought the black angus burger. I had to keep checking it as I ate it as I couldn't tell there was meat (flavorless) on the bread considering the sweetness of the cabbage. And don't get me started on the fries. I just threw away 8 buck.

ccJM9LE8qcmUWFNZtt--yQ.text: The next best thing to the original primanti brothers in the Strip District. Our servers are always friendly and our food is cooked to perfection. Great branch of Primanti's!

j8TaxtLpbe-Br5qGsfFTHA.text: "Yinz goin to Primanny's fer a sammy after the Stiller game n nat?"  This appears to be a Pittsburgh classic.  Coleslaw and fries up in your sandwich?  Ok.... that makes it easy to consume and turns out to be pretty effin' good.  Bomb ass sandwiches and relatively cheap beers.  Deals on Tuesday and Thursdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. Pastrami &amp; cheese!

1dSiM_Fl1BIIuPb2AawB0g.text: Wow!  Very impressed with the food and staff/waitresses!    Chicken sandwich was the best I've had in a while.  Very tender.    They custom made BBQ chicken sandwich with Swiss Cheese and Bacon.   Huge side of fries came with it.    Buffalo wings just right.    I'll be back.

f7sCMtUM-2cNeH6zX4E_EQ.text: OK this place is world-famous known for putting french fries on sandwiches on Thursdays they have family night, you get feed your whole family for just 20 bucks in this day and time tell me where that's possible OK maybe at McDonald's but this is quality food...

q22DFV8oFZIHgNSXe4EUIw.text: FRIES + MEAT + SLAW + ITALIAN BREAD = AWESOME.  We went twice for lunch while we were in the 'burgh- it was so good we had to go back the second day we were in town. The first day we were there we sat outside and were bracing ourselves as we looked at the menu preparing to fork over close to $10 for each sammy...but guess what?! They were about $6 each- fries and awesomeness included.   This location offers a spacious dining area including a full bar and a ton of TVs- I'm sure it would be a superior spot to watch the Stillers.   Yay, sammys!

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. seriously.

sTN6gqIX6v0rAxRcRKwWSQ.text: This place sucks if you want a primantis sandwich head downtown.  This place is the king of burning pizzas and watered down drinks.   Free benny b.

xxLzUxZ2p24XI8PZ9pD-jg.text: This is the quintessential Pittsburgh Meal, it is what I ate after a late night of drinking in the south side, strip, or Oakland. This is a burgh staple like the Dirty O, or Cat on a Stick after a night at the bar. that being said now that I am arrived and settled down, with a couple of kids it is nice to hit the Suburban Primanti's for a meal with the family, you can sit and enjoy a beer and a sandwich, and bring the kids without it being shady, and I can reminisce about my lost drunken youth, in a family friendly way.  And if you have never had a Primanti's sandwich, it is a requirement to live in the burgh, and if you are particularly brave, try the imported sardine, actually one of their best offerings. Particularly with beer.

W5J9zzdX3KOHZTNhE46Mqw.text: Ordered Pizza Feast, was told fifteen to twenty minutes. I arrived in eighteen minutes so was willing to wait.  Manager came and rang me out, stating it would be a couple more minutes. Then manager can and told me the wrong pizza was made. He said he would have another one made and I could have wrong one. I order pepperoni and sausage on half and extra cheese on whole. Well I received second pizza which had pepperoni on half sausage on quarter of that half and I can't tell you where the extra cheese was, seeing how you could see the sauce even on the just plain side. The Manager was very apologetic but you would think second pizza would be correct. I will still go there, everybody has a bad day.

3m55f8Ca9-qFLQN7QenQeA.text: I had a great experience at primanti  brothers with ( Mylee) always had a smile on her face and was so helpful and patient with me I would recommend this place

TeJM8B8hYFola65TWPvwOg.text: I eat at this location a lot , it's close to home and work and I am always grabbing something from them. I went a few days ago and my sandwich was cold and it wasn't prepared as I asked. The waitress apologized and said she would put in another one . I asked her to just box it up I was full on the appetizers we got. When the waitress took the sandwich back the kitchen staff member ate it I could see him from our table . He was eating while he was cooking orders . I paid my check and waited for my sandwich to come so I could leave. When it was brought over the waitress guaranteed me that it was correct. I left and I got home 10 mins later the sandwich was wrong and it wasn't even the sandwich I ordered . I called the manager and told him and he was told while we were there and he didn't seem to care to much. Last time I visit that location .

EcaaFw41qBK0JWnceB-m3w.text: I really enjoy Primanti's both roast beef and corned beef sandwich's. I also like the garlic parmesan boneless wings. The pizza is also pretty good. They are all good at any location other than North Versailles. For some reason they just can't make it happen. My bread was so stale it was literally as hard as a rock. As for the wings - they had so little sauce they were simply  tasteless greasy fried chicken bites. Our waitress was nice but brought our appetizer and food at the same time even after I requested her to hold our food order until our apps came so we could enjoy them without our food getting cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States
Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States

FzyhBAbPJ2xcblPNST8XyQ.text: My family and I love primantis but this location the past two times we've came has been a terrible experience. The first visit our server could barely wait on us because she was throwing a birthday party for her son at the same time. We decided to look past that experience and try for a second time. This time, while sitting next to the bar, we had a clear view of the of the cooks window. The entire time there seemed to be a frustrated cook yelling and fussing at the severs. We waited about 40 mins for our wings with no complaints because we were enjoying family time. Once our food arrived, it was ICE COLD. We politely notified our sever who apologized and quickly took our food back. As we watched, the server returned the food to the cook and he sighed "what now?!", assuming she told him we were not happy with our cold wings, he yelled "it's the f*cking sauce". Then he boldly stared at us like we were in the wrong. I asked the server who the manager was because we didn't appreciate the way he was handling our order, low and behold HE WAS THE MANAGER. We could not believe the foul mouth cook was the manager. This Primanti's lost our respect and our future business.

8EqD812SI7ZN4TgxFWMDGA.text: my my my, Primanti Bros. a classic, late night pittsburgh staple. it's the greasy bar food that you never really need, but sometimes, your body and brain are able to convince you to stop. tonight, i wish i would've gone to ANY of the other places open past 10. upon arrival, there was no host. some man from the kitchen who was bagging to-go orders asked us how many. after waiting 5 minutes, a server walked up and took us to our table. she did not take a drink order, just slapped the menus down on the table and walked away. after this, a different waitress came up to us and took our drink order. after we ordered drinks, FOUR other servers came to ask us if we had placed a drink order. another 15 minutes go by, and one of the many many waitresses that had checked on us finally took our food order. we ordered a spicy chicken sandwich and a chicken tender meal. the restaurant was not busy, and we still probably waited 30 minutes for our food to arrive. we were hungry after the wait, and we were served cold, greasy food. it's like they cooked french fries last night, left them out, and then microwaved them for us. we didn't receive the ranch for the sandwich or the honey buffalo we ordered. we had to ask three different times to get our sauces and then, a server brought us honey mustard and blue cheese dressing. communication at this restaurant is non existent and the banter between employees did not seem friendly. if you are looking for a late night bite, stick with a fast food drive through, or sheetz. you can thank me later.

k01rHUpAgbkDKXx9DhG6uQ.text: Great food! Amazing service! Bartender (Mylee) kept the drinks coming and always had a smile on her face! I Always love the Primantis experience!

h3h9oqOwfOCDkJpccDjW7w.text: I would love to eat here but I have been calling for an hour and the phone rings off the hook.

h5w3PRuxOnMWu9sv3f0EeQ.text: The sandwiches were excellent and a great value all were under $10.00 I had the pastrami one night and a fish sandwich the next. It's interesting putting coleslaw and French fries on the sandwich. I like the fact they have lots of TVs and a pool table. The only downside is it's noisy but I'm getting old and don't like a lot of noise but I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. Wow huge
Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. Nice seating
Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. Lots of TVs

mxlnHMdtA2o7QzIvn58RBw.text: Waited 15 minutes for someone to even acknowledge us while we sat. Finally decided to leave after two waitresses passed us for the fifth time and one actually sat down at an empty booth. Never coming to this location again. Will stick with the Monroeville location and other spots in the city.

0G_ISIEISpzsSjhvWd1kEQ.text: Great service. The food is good. The staff is friendly and polite and it only took 10 minutes for my food to come. I might be back soon.

HVHsh421sQ-D9yMF4-rRiQ.text: We visited Primanti Bros for the first time today after a trip to Kennywood.  It did not disappoint .  We had the giant pretzel to start. The honey mustard that came with it was delish.  I split the PB Rueben with my hubby, which was excellent.  Our son had the roast beef and cheese and somehow managed to eat the whole thing! Portions were huge and the food was very tasty.  Our daughter had the chicken gyro, and she said it was really good.  Savannah, our server, did an excellent job.  Our drinks were never empty and she was a pleasure to talk to!  We would definitely visit again if in the area.

VlnACDP91vDfIFnnWYOJyQ.text: Service is always good, food is amazing.  Love the sandwiches with the fries on top..best place for lunch or dinner or to have drinks an watch some sports

sNqOMUM8jUr3ecmqwgPQow.text: You can't come to Pittsburgh and not have a Primanti sandwich. This is a staple in our city. The menu has grown and typically there is something for everyone. On price it really can't get any better with all the food you get. For the kids it's a great place to eat as well. Awesome spot to watch games and great family atmosphere.

5T9rQc7_wEM2IVyOlegJFQ.text: I don't get the hype!  Lunch meat on Italian bread with fries and slaw?  What's so special? Just over priced hype.

g-fD54850noZtz8FIZ1vMQ.text: Primanti Bros is a staple in our house!. It is very True, you either love them or hate them.  We LOVE them.  I have even gone so far as to try to make my own at home. We have been eating Primanti's since the early 70's when the only place I knew of at the time was the strip district. Then several more popped up in all the right places. I am not as fond of the restaurant style they have now moved into, I still like the quick shop for a sandwich. The restaurant don't offer the quick service that the small sandwich shops do. It is nice to have a choice when you have kids with you.  The North Versailles is my least favorite, but it is the closest. The service is good here, but time from taking order to receiving isn't all that great. Monroeville isn't bad, either, slow service.  I still prefer the Strip District. They closed my favorite on Cherry Way, downtown, for a more of restaurant location in Market Square, just isn't the same.  The location in Oakland on campus is hard to get to when you can't find a parking space.  For the most part we have received a good sandwich, every now and then the bead was cut to small or the slaw was to over powering. For the most part it has been consistent. We have never had other restaurant foods either than the sandwiches. I have been meaning to try the pizza fest, but not as of now.   Something about the fries and slaw on the sandwich makes it for me. I like the Genoa & Cheese, The Roast Beef and the Pastrami.  Other family members have gone for the When Pigs Fly.  I do like trying the new creations for the Penguins.   One of our newest locations is Ft Lauderdale which is in another post. I am looking forward to trying the new restaurant in the Waterfront in Homestead.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States
Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. My own attempt
Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States. Take Out

1_2Qjmw6ww2kLxsjZ7-bng.text: So basically the bartenders are unavailable stupid and not caring. The food is garbage the only Primanti's that I've ever been to that was decent was the one in state college probably because the employees have a brain. Here when you ask for a manager they know less than the idiot employee you are having an issue with this place needs to be rivertowned

aTvsXVDeX2sfgSSSvw-_gQ.text: Worst primantis location by far. Upon arrival , my family and i stepped over chicken , fench fries , napkins and wrappers all over the floor in the middle of the dining area.  Our waitress , santara , wasnt friendly at all and had no pep in her step . we ordered Queso and chips to start - the chips came out soft and rubbery . they were never dried , the were saturated in fryer grease. We told our server who took our chips and let our cheese sit on the table . 20 minutes later , my sandwich & my fiances wings came out - and the chips from our appetizer were no where to be seen . the waitress that brought our dinner out(not santara) then took our cheese only to reheat it and reserve it with my chips that came another 15 minutes after my main course. Filthy , rude employees , crap service and the food was hardly warm wheb it came out . GROSS .

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - North Versailles, PA, United States

2Cb3Q8XmYV4n0Y9amCG-cg.text: Love primantis sandwiches and the prices are always good. My fiance and I went tonight and tried their new sandwich with pulled pork...yum. But the bartender Jen, who was pleasant to you when she came by, was purposely inefficient and I watched the whole bar suffer from it. We sat down and waiting a solid 8 minutes to even see a bartender behind the bar. She was waiting for food to be ready by the kitchen the whole time.  She refused to make eye contact so the possibility of someone speaking to her or asking for something was impossible until she was ready to acknowledge you. I have been in the industry and there are lots of ways to be efficient and not get swamped. Fyi the bar was not crowded. Made what was to be a quick bite feel endless, as everything needed was a wait, even our silverware. We sat with our sandwiches in front of us and she left the bar to get something else with the silverware we asked for sitting by the register. Always recommend primantis but just felt the need to express the service.

nPi0fP0SOhxmUNoZuCwjlg.text: Ordered $45 worth of food here and it was all crap. The Caribbean chop salad was just lettuce & chicken plus cucumbers which I asked be deleted. The fries were soggy & inedible. The honey mustard wings were just honey -no mustard at all. Terrible food & a waste of money.

MFZOrolnAff4H369E5HLsA.text: Absolute worst experience ever. Started out with the waitress (later learned was Mylee) , asking us our order without writing it down. After giving my order she grabbed the menu from my hands and said "I'm sorry I need to look at the menu and can you tell me it again?" I almost wanted to invest in a notepad for her. Our food was then brought out missing two items I ordered, by ANOTHER server because Mylee was too busy sitting in a booth eating her dinner and txting. Never once were we asked how our food was, to which I would have explained I never even got half the stuff I ordered. The food was terrible enough that my mother literally didn't even want to take it home. Worst primantis experience ever and would never come back to this store again.
